Table of Contents

Name


CplantFamilyTermination, CplantFamilyTerminationGrp

Synopsis


#include <cplant.h> int CplantFamilyTermination(jobFamilyInfo *job, int *exitCod e, int *termSig, int *terminator, int *done, int len) int CplantFamilyTerminationGrp(jobFamilyInfo *job, int *exit Code, int *termSig, int *terminator, int *done, int len, int nMembers, int *rankList, int tmout)

Description


The function CplantFamilyTermination returns termination information about the specified job. job is a handle returned by CplantSpawnJob, CplantMyParent or CplantMySelf. If done is not NULL, it is taken to point to an array of size len. done[p] is set to 1 if the process with rank p in the application has terminated, and 0 if it has not. If exitCode is not NULL, it is taken to point to an array of size len. exitCode[p] is set to exit code of the rank p process. If termSig is not NULL, it is taken to point to an array of size len and termSig[p] is set to the terminating signal, if any, of the rank p process. If terminator is not NULL, it is taken to point to an array of size len and terminator[p] is set to one of PCT_JOB_OWNER or PCT_ADMINISTRATOR respectively if the process was aborted by the job's owner or by a system administrator. The function CplantFamilyTerminationGrp is a collective call. Every process that participates in the request must make the call with the same list of participants. nMembers is the number of processes participating in the call, rankList is the list of participating process ranks, and tmout is the number of seconds to wait before judging a collective operation among the pariticpants to be a failure. In our implementation of this call, the first process in the rankList makes the request to yod2 and broadcasts the results to the others. If nMembers is zero, or rankList is NULL, then this is taken to mean that all processes in the application are participating.

Return Value


Both functions return -1 on error, and 0 on success.

See Also


yod2 CplantSpawnJob CplantMyParent CplantMySelf
